subject: Olympic Games
Layoffs and Job Reductions
lead_paragraph: The economy forced leaders of the United States Olympic Committee to cut the federation’s work force by up to 15 percent as a way of saving more than $7.1 million in the 2009 budget. The U.S.O.C. said it was more a pre-emptive move than a reflection on its less-than-full slate of sponsors. Still, the sponsorship issue is significant and five key slots — worth around $15 million each — remain unfilled. usoc.
